section.p: Use these inline elements when referring to elements within the graphic user interface:not included in this list because not common: shortcut, screen, msgph, msgblock, msgnum

row.entry: user interface control <uicontrol>Use <uicontrol> to mark up any item that might appear on a screen, such as a window title, button label, menu option, or field name.
file path <filepath>Use the <filepath> element to mark up both file paths and file names.

menu cascade <menucascade>Use the <menucascade> to present a series of menu choices. The <menucascade> element contains two or more <uicontrol> elements. On output, the content of the <uicontrol> elements will be bold and separated by an angle bracket (>).
window title <wintitle>Use the <wintitle> element to mark up the title of a window, dialog box, tab, or wizard page name.

section.p: Use the table below to select the appropriate inline element when documenting a user interface.

row.entry: <uicontrol>; to include the actual icon, use the <image> element.
Field names, radio or checkbox names, dropdown menu selections
System messages or output of any kind
Anything that the user must type verbatim
Variables that the user must replace with their own information
